oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spintronic oscillator based on magnetic field feedback
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DIXIT, D
KONISHI, K
TOMY, CV
SUZUKI, Y
TULAPURKAR, AA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ROOM-TEMPERATURE
MAGNETORESISTANCE
DRIVEN
EMISSION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a circuit design of a spintronic oscillator based on a magnetic tunnel junction (MTJ). In this design, a dc current is passed through a magnetic tunnel junction which is connected to a "feed-back" wire below it. Any fluctuation in the magnetization direction of the free layer of MTJ, drives a fluctuating current through the feed-back wire, which exerts a magnetic field on the free layer. This in turn can amplify the magnetization fluctuations. If the dc current passing through the MTJ is more than a critical value, periodic precessional states of the magnetization are possible. (C) 2012 American Institute of Physics. [http://dx.doi.org/10.1063/1.4752008]
